relation: Referred to the committee on State Administration and Regulatory Oversight
Hearing scheduled for 01/29/2014 from 10:00 AM-01:00 PM in B-2
Resolve reported favorably by committee and referred to the committee on Rules of the two branches, acting concurrently
title: Actions for Resolve H.2890
textBeforeTable: The Commission shall issue a report no later than 270 days after its first organizational meeting. Said study shall include, but not be limited to, the issue of fair market compensation for use of state property, the ability to screen advertisements and the authority of state agencies to sell advertising space. The Commission shall consist of 3 members of the Senate, 5 members of the House of Representatives, one of whom shall be the house chairman of the science and technology committee, and 3 persons to be appointed by the governor. There is hereby established a special commission to study the feasibility of permitting private sector advertising on state websites. The Commission shall study and analyze whether private sector advertising on state websites is a practicable initiative to generate revenue. Miscellaneous Bill History Bill Text Print Preview
